els.title: Gulf Stream
els.text: This fast-moving current transports warm water from the tropics north along the coast of North America.

els.title: Kuroshio Current
els.text: A warm current running north from the tropics. In the mid-latitudes, it joins the North Pacific current and flows eastward, across the Pacific.

els.title: Hadley cells
els.text: Warm air rises from the equator, then cools as it moves toward the poles. Cool air sinks to the surface, creating a loop of air circulation known as a Hadley cell.
